summary: Build a cute Valentine proposal website for Bhavica featuring a "Will you be my valentine?" prompt with Yes/No buttons, a playful evasive No button with cute prompts, and a celebratory meme/message reveal after Yes.
architectural_notes: Single-page interactive website with client-side JavaScript handling button movement and state transitions (question -> interaction -> celebration reveal).
Enhance evasive “No” button behavior to move to widely varying/random positions across the full viewport (not small offsets) on click/hover/tap.
Celebration state should support rendering a user-provided/uploaded photo asset as part of the final reveal.
known_issues: “No” button evasive movement is currently too limited; it is not moving around much across the screen.
User-uploaded photo is not loading/displaying in the celebration view.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page Valentine proposal experience addressed to “Bhavika” that displays the main prompt in English: “Bhavika, will you be my Valentine?” and presents two clear buttons: “Yes” and “No”.

Implement a playful evasive “No” button behavior: when the user attempts to hover/tap/click the “No” button, it should move to a different position on the screen so it is difficult to click, and it should display rotating cute prompt text feedback (e.g., short playful messages) near the buttons.

When the user clicks “Yes”, transition the UI into a celebration state that reveals a celebratory meme image and displays the English message: “Haha, I knew you’d say yes! I’d like to be your Valentine too.”

Apply a cohesive, cute Valentine-themed visual design (distinct style, consistent typography, spacing, and components) using a warm palette (avoid blue/purple) and subtle animations (e.g., gentle floating hearts / confetti feel) appropriate for a romantic proposal page.
Add the required generated images as static frontend assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and render them in the UI (proposal/celebration views) without fetching them from the backend.
Update the proposal page so the displayed recipient name is spelled “Bhavica” (not “Bhavika”) everywhere it appears in user-facing UI text.

After the user presses the “Yes” button and the celebration view is shown, display the user-uploaded photo at the end of the celebration content (below the existing celebration meme and messages), without fetching it from the backend.

Increase the evasive behavior of the “No” button so that when it is clicked/tapped/pointer-pressed it can move to positions across (nearly) the entire available screen area, instead of only moving small distances.

Fix the celebration view so the final uploaded photo reliably loads from static assets, using a valid file path under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` (and matching the actual filename and extension) rather than a broken/missing reference.

Add graceful error handling for the final photo in the celebration view: if the photo cannot be loaded, show a small English fallback message in the UI (and avoid layout breaking), and log a clear console warning indicating the missing/failed image path.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create Valentine proposal landing page addressed to Bhavika with main prompt "Will you be my valentine?"
Add Yes/No options with an evasive/moving No button that avoids clicks
Show cute prompts/messages as the user tries to click No
On Yes, reveal a celebratory meme and final message (e.g., "Haha I knew you would say yes")
On Yes/celebration reveal, display the user-uploaded photo at the end (final reveal)

projectName: Cute Valentine Proposal Website for Bhavica (Yes/No with evasive No + celebration reveal)
